title: Can I exclude the junk folder from the unified folders?

creator: tiger.claw

title: Why not add an option start Thunderbird in the background on system startup?
content:
Happy to see thunderbird is doing better and better recent years. I think it is now the time to add an option to allow it automatically startup in the background on system startup, which has been asked for several years. That is a really useful option, why not just implement it?

I think there are 2 ways: 1. Just automatically startup in the background on system startup and receive messages 2. Register a service in the background to receive e-mails and pop up notifications, and in this case, we don't need to add this option

The first solution may be easier to implement, but the second seems better? Anyway, thunderbird should have one of them

BTW, add an option to minimalize when click on 'close' button. I know there's an extension for this, so why not just integrate it :-)

Thanks!
creator: Arcticn

title: Emails sent to trash sometimes turn into gibberish and cannot be repaired
content:
Sometimes when I consign an email to the trash and then need to re-read it later, it's turned into gibberish. A tiny fraction of a recent is below. I've used the "repair text encoding" feature, without any result. If I scroll further down in the gibberish, there are links that weren't in the original email and would have had to be sucked in from other emails in trash, which I just don't get. I can go back to the email on my phone, but on my desktop, they are hopelessly jumbled. What causes this and how can I stop it? Thanks!

title: Thunderbird Update-prospective 115 to 128-completely turn off check (temporarily)
content:
I normally have TB set to check for updates and allow me to choose to install them. This has in past releases broken some add-ons that are important to me; either because the developer hasn't caught up or has given up maintaining it/them.

I see from the Addons compatibility checker that a couple of them, specifically QNote and ImportExportTools NG are flagged as currently incompatible with 128, and if these stop working before being updated, I will endure serious problems, especially with ImportExportTools, which I use to save and archive critical correspondence.

I would therefore like to be able to turn off update checking of any sort, so that my current version of TB and relevant add-ons continue to work. When the compatibility checks tell me that the add-ons are now updated to 128 (and upwards) compatibility, then I can take off the update check block and carry on with updating. That is, until this particular problem recurs.

I imagine this is something in config, but it would help and save me time if anyone could advise me.
creator: piscator1591
